title: Marker ID
content:
Do you know what font this script/marker type is set in? Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [gomma-vs-032c.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091107225456/http:/typophile.com/files/gomma-vs-032c.jpg) | 71.12 KB |
author: hifromj

comments.content:
Very close (but not identical) to [Dom Casual Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20091107225456/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/dom-casual/). Several other brush-drawn fonts are also similar, but I have not yet found the exact match.

- Mike Yanega
thanks, I appreciate it, but I find the sample a little more rigorous in terms of precision and drawing, it’s intriguing because it’s still very systematic and somewhat geometric.

You might check some of the comic book font places, like Comicraft or Blambot. That sort of lettering is also similar to this style, I think.

- Mike Yanega

A couple of the fonts in House’s [Sign Painter Font kit](http://web.archive.org/web/20091107225456/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/signpainterfontkit/viewfonts) are pretty close, but still not an exact match. Is there a reason that it needs to be EXACTLY this font? Some suggestions that have been made would be so close that without side-by-side comparison 95 people out of 100 would not know they were different.

- Mike Yanega
